intro: Cleidion tenuispica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cleidion, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
